Class Player

java.lang.Object
logic.character.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents the player character in the game.

The player maintains combat-related attributes such as health, action points, equipment types (sword, helmet, suit), and status effects (buff and freeze). These attributes influence both player actions and enemy damage calculations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player()
    Creates a new player with default starting stats: Health = 100 Action Points = 5 (maximum) No buff, no freeze Equipment types set to 0 (none)

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Creates a new player with default starting stats:
      • Health = 100
      • Action Points = 5 (maximum)
      • No buff, no freeze
      • Equipment types set to 0 (none)

  • Method Details

    • setBuff

      public void setBuff(boolean buff)
      Enables or disables the buff status for the player. Buff generally reduces incoming damage from enemies.
      Parameters:
      buff - true to enable buff, false to disable

    • isFreeze

      public boolean isFreeze()
      Returns whether the player is currently frozen.
      Returns:
      true if frozen; otherwise false

    • setFreeze

      public void setFreeze(boolean freeze)
      Sets the frozen status of the player. Frozen players may be restricted from acting according to game logic.
      Parameters:
      freeze - true to freeze the player; false to unfreeze

    • getActionPoint

      public int getActionPoint()
      Returns the current number of Action Points (AP) the player has. Action Points are used to perform various actions during combat.
      Returns:
      current AP value

    • setActionPoint

      public void setActionPoint(int actionpoint)
      Sets the player's Action Points.

      AP is clamped between 0 and 5.

      Parameters:
      actionpoint - new AP value

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Returns the player's current health.
      Returns:
      current health value

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth(int health)
      Sets the player's health, clamping the value to a minimum of 0.
      Parameters:
      health - new health value

    • isBuff

      public boolean isBuff()
      Returns whether the player currently has an active buff.
      Returns:
      true if buff is active; otherwise false

    • setSwordType

      public void setSwordType(int swordType)
      Sets the sword type the player is holding. Invalid values (invalid input: '<'0 or >2) default to 0 (none).
      Parameters:
      swordType - sword type code

    • setHelmetType

      public void setHelmetType(int helmetType)
      Sets the helmet type the player is wearing. Invalid values (invalid input: '<'0 or >2) default to 0 (none).
      Parameters:
      helmetType - helmet type code

    • setSuitType

      public void setSuitType(int suitType)
      Sets the suit type the player is wearing. Invalid values (invalid input: '<'0 or >2) default to 0 (none).
      Parameters:
      suitType - suit type code

    • getSwordType

      public int getSwordType()
      Returns the sword type code.
      Returns:
      the sword type (0–2)

    • getHelmetType

      public int getHelmetType()
      Returns the helmet type code.
      Returns:
      the helmet type (0–2)

    • getSuitType

      public int getSuitType()
      Returns the suit type code.
      Returns:
      the suit type (0–2)
